data.title: JavaScript Missing Type Validation in 0.10.10
data.body:
In 0.10.8, if I have a TypeScript Definition for a JavaScript file, there is validation done on the parameters. This was particularly useful for finding broken APIs.

Example of definition file and code:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7843164/13714107/8da20336-e79a-11e5-87e5-8a3164caabec.png)

In 0.10.8, a warning is shown for an incorrect type:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7843164/13714116/9f7416f8-e79a-11e5-9063-7b0ed08021f5.png)

Now, in 0.10.10, there is no validation at all. The "100" shows as being valid:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7843164/13714176/0722b250-e79b-11e5-9cf5-c353ab67501c.png)

Losing the validation is a big loss. When switching to Salsa, was this the intention? Is there any properties that can be set to have the JavaScript intellisense + validation go back to the old engine (I believe it was using the TypeScript engine).

Thanks

data.title: Format Code is not changing when .vscode/settings.json is changed
data.body:
When I change values in `settings.json` it does not change the behavior of Format Code immediately. I have to quit and restart VS Code to change the behavior. 
### Testing

If I change the tab size to a value like 6 and format a source file it does not change. I restart VS Code and try again and I get 6 spaces for indentation. I believe I was able to change `settings.json` in a previous version and it would change immediately. I did upgrade to the latest version this week. There appear to be some regressions. Love the code folding though! Thanks!

``` json
{
    "editor.tabSize": 2,
    "editor.insertSpaces": true,
    "editor.wrappingIndent": "same"
}
```

data.title: Format Code appears to indent differently than expected
Ctrl+C on blank empty line copies new line and overwrites clipboard
data.body:
OS: Windows 10
Build#: 0.10.12-alpha
Node: 4.1.1

As the title says, if you have already copied something and you Ctrl+C on a separate blank line, it will overwrite your clipboard and hold a newline character. Normally when you copy with the cursor not selecting anything on a new line, it will hold your previous copy.

data.title: adding telemetry to json extension
data.body: This PR adds telemetry support for the JSON extension, without adding any actual reporting.

data.title: [PHP] Poorly formatted php does not hit set breakpoints
data.body:
OS: Windows 10
Build#: 0.10.12-alpha
Node: 4.1.1

When debugging php with XDebug, if the code is not correctly formatted a breakpoint will not hit.
Example:

data.title: Debugging Session Start Button should prevent double submission

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It's possible to start several debugging sessions at the same time by clicking the Debugging Session start button really fast. This leads to incorrect behavior of the debugging experience.
Pressing F5 multiple times has the same effect.

data.title: [PHP] Running format code with leading indented php tag deletes php
data.body:
OS: Windows 10
Build#: 0.10.12-alpha
Node: 4.1.1

If you have an opening `<?php` tag indented (with either tab or spaces) at the beginning of a php file and right click -> Format Code, it deletes all the php code included until the closing `?>` tag.
Additionally, if there are no html tags later on in the file, Format Code seems to do nothing.

Steps:
1. Open a new PHP file.
2. Add a tabbed `<?php    ?>` 
3. Add any html tags `<html> <body></body> </html>`
4. Right click -> Format Code or Alt+Shift+F
5. Removes leading php tags and any included code.

Expected:
Formats PHP code and does not delete it.

data.title: Typescript syntax highlighting breaks when method return type has a number in the name
data.body:
When my return type on a method has a number in it, the syntax highlighting breaks for that method.
I'm using 0.10.10

data.body:
OS: Windows 10
Build#: 0.10.12-alpha

Adding the entire array to the watch list works as expected.

Example:

data.title: Debug: always load default option ...

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi there,

I have two options in my projet with vscode.
The default one `Launch` is used to compile my Typescripts then running a `live-server`.
The second one `Tests` is used to run tests using karma.

The problem is that when I select `Tests` then run, it will always run the `Launch` option instead.

In order for the `Tests` option to work I have to restart vscode every time I change the select input ...

Here's my configurations array:

```
    {
        "name": "Launch",
        "type": "node",
        "request": "launch",
        "program": "${workspaceRoot}/.vscode/launch_debug.js",
        "stopOnEntry": false,
        "args": [],
        "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
        "runtimeExecutable": null,
        "runtimeArgs": [
            "--nolazy"
        ],
        "env": {
            "NODE_ENV": "development"
        },
        "externalConsole": false,
        "sourceMaps": false,
        "outDir": null
    },
    {
        "name": "Tests",
        "type": "node",
        "request": "launch",
        "program": "${workspaceRoot}/.vscode/launch_tests.js",
        "stopOnEntry": false,
        "args": [],
        "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
        "runtimeExecutable": null,
        "runtimeArgs": [
            "--nolazy"
        ],
        "env": {
            "NODE_ENV": "development"
        },
        "externalConsole": false,
        "sourceMaps": false,
        "outDir": null
    }
```

`

data.title: Debugger: On stopping event, Code does display any source location if top stack frame does not have source information.
Debug adapter can pass a 'More Information' url to the frontend
data.body:
- [x] any platform @chrisdias 

for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3448

Error messages in the debug protocol have been extended to support a 'More Information' url and a corresponding label. VS Code uses this optional information to show a button in error notifications.

Currently this is used in node-debug when a launch configuration contains relative paths.

Verify that the button is shown in error notifications and that the correct "Common Error" web page opens.

data.title: feature request: elastic tabstops
data.body:
[See details here](http://nickgravgaard.com/elastic-tabstops/)

Summary: "elastic tabstops" allow tabs to be aligned across adjacent lines.

![Example of elastic tabstops in action](http://nickgravgaard.com/elastic-tabstops/columnblocks_coloured.gif)

data.title: Test extensions status bar widget
data.body:
Related to #3540, #2835
### Assignees
- [x] Linux @isidorn 
- [x] OS X @bpasero 
### Description

The extensions status bar widget changed considerably.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13709292/6ebb31ae-e7b3-11e5-9457-b7df9b7f6459.png)
- Clicking it in its default state should open Quick Open with the text `> Extensions:` to display all extension related commands.
- It should report extension errors on startup with a decoration on its icon.
  - You can trigger an extension error by causing a syntax error in its `package.json`, for instance.
  - Clicking the widget then should display the errors and make the decoration go away.
  - You can only click it once.
- It should report extension updates with another decoration.
  - You can trigger this by editing an extension's `package.json` and rollback its version number as well as rename the folder in which it is installed (which contains the version).
  - Clicking the widget should display the outdated extensions.
  - This indicator never goes away while you have outdated extensions. It's a motivator to keep up to date.
  - The indicator should also update accordingly when installing/uninstalling extensions.
- It should report when extensions are being installed.

data.title: Test release notes notification
data.body:
Related to #3525
### Assignees
- [x] OS X @isidorn 
- [x] Windows @bgashler1 
### Description

A notification should now appear every time you update Code to a new version, in order to get more users to read the release notes:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13709038/27db44c8-e7b2-11e5-88ba-e9e77edc7fb5.png)
- You should get this message every time Code updates to a new version.
- You should not get it when you install a brand new Code.
- Note that it is the _semver_ version that needs to change in order to get this popup, not the commit ID.
- The previous version is always stored in the storage key `storage://global/releasenotes/lastversion`. It is the value used to figure out whether an update happened, so feel free to edit this when testing.

data.title: Test new Java/Type-script settings
Open file in project by typing partial name
data.body: I'm using Mac OS X with Visual Studio Code 0.10.10. How do I use the keyboard to open a file, using its partial name, in the currently open project? I can't find a command in the Command Palette that would enable me to do this. As best I can tell, there is a command that does this for Working Files (see screenshot), but **not** for the currently open project. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/35944316/vscode-open-file-in-project Cheers, Trevor Sullivan Microsoft MVP: PowerShell

data.title: Error while debugging extension : Attribute 'outDir' ('out/src') is not an absolute path; consider adding '${workspaceRoot}/'
data.body:
Hi , 
when i try to debug extension in VSCODE i get the following error in launch.json file

> Attribute 'outDir' ('out/src') is not an absolute path; consider adding '${workspaceRoot}/' as a prefix to make it absolute.

Following is my json file

```
// A launch configuration that compiles the extension and then opens it inside a new window
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch Extension",
            "type": "extensionHost",
            "request": "launch",
            "runtimeExecutable": "${execPath}",
            "args": ["--extensionDevelopmentPath=${workspaceRoot}" ],
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "outDir": "out/src",
            "preLaunchTask": "npm"
        },
        {
            "name": "Launch Tests",
            "type": "extensionHost",
            "request": "launch",
            "runtimeExecutable": "${execPath}",
            "args": ["--extensionDevelopmentPath=${workspaceRoot}", "--extensionTestsPath=${workspaceRoot}/out/test" ],
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "outDir": "out/test",
            "preLaunchTask": "npm"
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: Test new tasks.json creation
data.body:
**Assignees:**
- [x] Windows @egamma 
- [x] OS X @chrisdias 
- [x] Linux @isidorn

**Items:**
The UI for creating a new tasks.json file got reworked. To test do the following:
- workspace without tasks.json file
- run Configure Task Runner action
- you should be presented with a picker like this:

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/13729547/a26ecae4-e937-11e5-84e4-debf5129a8a5.png)
- test all the different entries. And ensure that they generate a proper tasks.json file. Please not that for running a task the tools referred by the tasks.json file must be installed (e.g. gulp, jake, grunt, tsc, ...)
- if you have a gulpfile.js, jakefile or gruntfile ensure that the auto detection is run and that the tasks.json contains a detected build tasks. For the following gulpfile.js 

``` JavaScript
var gulp = require('gulp');

gulp.task('build', function() {
    console.log('build'); 
});
```

the autodetection should detect the build task.
- also ensure that if a gulp, jake or grunt file exist and you select any other entry no auto detection is run and the proper tasks.json file is generated.

data.title: Test localized product
data.body:
**Assignees:**
- [x] Windows @alexandrudima, @egamma
- [x] OS X @waderyan 
- [x] Linux @aeschli 

**Items:**
Please note that minor parts of the product are still not translated. We have in total 136 untranslated strings. If a strings shows up in the user interface untranslated and you want to check if the strings is correctly externalized start in locale=pseudo and check if the string is enclosed in [ ] and has doubled vowels. 
- Start VSCode from the command line and pass the --locale argument. Test the following values and ensure that the UI is at least partly localized: de, es, fr, it, ja, ko, ru, zh-cn, zh-tw.
- Test that language reduction works. Start code with --locale=de-DE and ensure that you get a German user interface
- Test that VSCode picks up your OS setting. So switch the OS to one of the above locales and start VSCOde WITHOUT the locale parameter. Ensure that the user interface is rendered in the correct language.

data.title: Refreshing secondary window when debugging an extension causes debug sidebar to open

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
From #4011 

When debugging a vscode extension
1. Close the debug sidebar
2. Restart the debugging by refreshing the secondary vscode window (that was created when debugging started) with `ctrl+r`

Expected behaviour: The debug sidebar remains closed (the same as if you refresh by pressing `ctrl+shift+f5` in the main window).
Actual behaviour: The debug sidebar opens again.

data.title: massive leakage with search viewlet
data.body:
- Set up a workspace as outlined here: Microsoft/TypeScript#7444
- show search viewlet, search for `bab` once, wait for results, clear results
- take a heap snapshot
- search again for `bab`, when done press _refresh_, repeat 5 time
- clear results
- take another snapshot, heap grew by ~30MB

data.title: asking to remove alias from .bash_profile
Delete on subst drive doesn't work anymore
data.body:
Windows
- subst a drive
- select a file, execute delete
- Confirm OK
- Message appears that the file can't be moved to trash. Select 'Delete Permanently'

Observe:
- file quickly disappears in the explorer and then reappears

data.title: [html] Expose the HTML formatter options as user settings
Configure Excludes minor UI polish
data.body:
Regarding the configure excludes demoed today at standup. Here are some ux polish suggestions:
- Do not make the text or the light bulb green, regular white should do just fine. Why should this be green as compared to the rest of the status bar - in what way is it special. We also do not have a concept of introducing new colors in the status bar.
- 'Configure Excludes' should have the first case capital both in the status bar and in the action in the message service

data.title: Option to have debug sidebar not appear when starting/restarting debugging
data.body:
I work with the sidebar normally closed so it's very annoying for me that the debug sidebar keeps popping out whenever starting or restarting debugging. It's not just having to press ctrl+b each time; it's also jarring visually. Would very much appreciate this option :)

Even if the just sidebar only popped out when starting and not every time when restarting that would be an improvement.

data.title: Leak: extfs uses unbounded cache for unicode normalization
data.body:
- Set up a workspace as outlined here: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/7444
- find the `tmp` folder in the explorer and expand it (there is only 1 items)
- take a heap snapshot
- run `ember serve`, wait for it start, notice the `tmp` folder being populated, and stop the server. 
- repeat the previous step 2 or 3 times
- take another heap snapshot
- memory grew by ~1MB

data.title: Missing command to set focus to "currently open project" in side bar
data.body: Someone closed out the last issue I had open for this, without a proper answer, so I'm creating a new one. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3968 > There's options for View: Focus into Side Bar and View: Focus on Working Files, but there isn't any option for View: Focus into Open Project. Please add this. The "answer" that was authoritatively posted into that thread, only works if focus was not previously set to the _Working Files_ section of the Side Bar. If _Working Files_ was the last "area" to have focus in the Side Bar, before focus was moved away, then the `CMD + SHIFT + E` shortcut will simply return it to _Working Files_ instead of the project. **SIDE NOTE**: I'd recommend allowing people some time to respond, before closing out their GitHub issues. People who don't administer the GitHub project **cannot** re-open their issues, if they're closed out by a project member. Recently, I've been quite diligent about following up on tickets that I've reported, so I'd appreciate an opportunity to hash things out fully, instead of assumptions being made. The Visual Studio Code team has been doing some very good work; it's my hope that this continues. Cheers, Trevor Sullivan Microsoft MVP: PowerShell
